result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tommy L Knutowski in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller (as friend of the court).

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: to Seal Victim Impact Statement(s) signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 05/18/2022.
Motion and Order to Seal Victim Impact Statements, filed by District Attorney
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tommy L Knutowski in court, in custody, with attorney Cassandra A Miller (as friend of the court).  
Court to Address:  Status of Competency - Evaluation Prepared by Dr. Peissig.

Dr. Peissig's competency report now finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Both the State and Defense have received copies of the evaluation.
Neither the State or Defense are contesting the finds or requesting an additional evaluation.
Court Finds the defendant is competent to proceed at this time.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Review hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
filed by Dr. Emily Peissig, Wisconsin Department of Health Services.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Order Of Commitment For Treatment (Incompetency).
Signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 04/13/22.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Tommy L Knutowski NOT in court, in custody, with attorney Cassie Miller (as friend of the court).
Court waives the defendant's appearance.
Court to Address:  Competency Evaluation Ordered by the Commissioner.

Court previously found the defendant No Competent but likely to regain on 21CF1518, 21CF1710 & 22CM421 on 04/04/22 - Order for Commitment for Treatment was also previously ordered.
Neither the State or Defense are requesting an additional Competency Evaluation on this case.
Therefore, Court will vacate the commissioner's order for an additional competency evaluation.

Court will based on the Competency Evaluation originally prepared by Dr. Niess on the above cases will finds the defendant not competent but likely to regain within the statutory time frame.
Court will commit the defendant to the Department of Health Services for in-patient treatment to competency.
Court will also find the defendant is not competent to refuse medications.
Court will grant 7 Days Credit.
Order to Commitment for Treatment to be prepared.
Review hearing on April 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:04 PM Defendant Tommy L Knutowski in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the Waukesha, County of.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney Miller will be appointed.
Attorney Herbers states that the Defendant was deemed incompetent and requests a dismissal.
DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Check Case scheduled for May 6, 2022.
